sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This chapter contains many of the txn configuration options.

sect1.title: Customizing a txn
sect1.para: It is important to realize that a TransactionFactoryBuilder is immutable, so if a configuration method is called, a new instance is returned. This instance should be used to do the following configuration step or by used for creating the AtomicBlock.

sect1.title: Familyname

Maximum retries
Don't rely on Transaction instance
sect1.para: To prevent causing a lot of unwanted gc overhead, txn instances are reused. This means that the same txn instance could be used for different executions of the same AtomicBlock, but it also could be reused to execute a completely different AtomicBlock. That is why it is important to realize that Transaction instances should not be stored.
